name: Mixed Raw Vegetables and Cashew Nuts in Chilli, Soy and Ginger
author: Daylesford
ingredients:
- 3 medium carrots
- 3 raw medium beetroots
- 1/4 of a small red cabbage
- 1/4 of a small white cabbage
- 1 small red pepper, de-seeded and finely sliced
- 1/2 a medium red onion, finely sliced
- 1 small bunch fresh mint, chopped
- 1 small bunch of coriander leaves
- 25g cashew nuts, lightly toasted in a frying pan and roughly chopped

For the dressing:
- 100ml soy sauce
- 100g clear honey
- juice of 4 limes
- 1 tbsp caster sugar
- 2 cloves garlic, chopped
- 2cm ginger, finely chopped
- 1 red chilli, de-seeded and finely chopped
- 75g cashew nuts
instructions:
To make the dressing:
- Put all the ingredients, except for the cashews, into a small pan. Bring to a gentle simmer, stirring constantly, and cook for 2 minutes, then remove from the heat and leave to cool.
- Put the cashew nuts into a blender with the cooled dressing, and blitz until smooth

To make the salad:
- Using a mandolin to slice and a knife to julienne, make thin strips of all of the vegetables and add to a bowl.
- Add the remaining main ingredients and toss to mix.
- Drizzle with the dressing to serve.
